metadata.title: Post Malone - I Had Some Help (feat. Morgan Wallen)
metadata.creator: Post Malone

tracks.text: Post Malone stands in a telephone booth outside of a dive bar boasting karaoke night and happy hour. A young brunette woman with a low cut top and a cowboy hat knocks on the booth window and Malone nods. After finishing his call, Malone, hits the phone against the cradle, breathes out smoke, and approaches the bar.
Entering the bar, Malone picks up the bouncer's half drunk beer and downs it.
He slides the beer down the bar, and it refills with beer.
At the other end, he picks it up, and clinks the glasses with women in cowboy hats.
Malone sings to us. He is a tall man with face tattoos, a scruffy beard, and a baseball hat that reads Dallas upside down.
He notices a microphone
He sings, walking towards us, into the mic. The song appears on a karaoke sing along screen.
He steps onto a table, smashing a beer bottle.
He sips another beer.
He moves through the bar as people dance. The bouncer eyes him.
Malone dances on a table, drinks, and smokes something. A bald tattooed man approaches him.
The bouncer and bald man toss Malone into the dirt outside.
Morgan Wallen approaches. Wallen sports a mustache, plaid button down shirt, a Hancock County baseball cap, and cross necklace.
Wallen taps Malone with his toe. Malone looks up, and Wallen waves and laughs.
Elsewhere, Wallen and Malone sit in the bed of a white pickup truck while an American flag flies above them.
Wallen helps Malone up, dusts him off, and puts his Dallas baseball cap on Malone's head.
In front of the bar, 2 young women pull up in a white pickup truck. Malone and Wallen look at each other.
Trucks drive quickly in the dirt and dark.
Wallen and Malone sing in the truck bed or in front of the bar.
Trucks drive in the dirt. The American flag flies.
People dance at the bar.
An old man drinks in front of the Tennessee state flag.
Malone pats his chest, then points at us.
Fireworks explode behind the truck and flag.
People dance in the bar. Malone smokes. Wallen sings. Fireworks explode. Malone drinks.
In the phone booth, Malone smokes. Using his tongue, he pulls the lit blunt into his mouth, closes it, and then reveals the dampened butt in a cloud of smoke.
Malone dances on a table. On stage, he faces away from us and rocks his hips from side to side.
In the truck, Malone makes a heart sign to us with his hands. He takes off his cap, then places it over our view.
Title card. I had some help. Post Malone, featuring Morgan Wallen. Credits roll.
